description: From joy +‎ -ant. Compare Old French joyant, joiant (“joyful; merry; rejoicing”).

adjectives.description: joyant (comparative more joyant, superlative most joyant)

examples: Jealousy may have played some part in the misunderstanding, for it was undeniable that there was a sprightliness, a joyant brightness, in the flowing red scarf on Ignatius Aloysius's nautical breast, which was nowhere paralleled in Patrick's more subdued array.

description: Imitation of the Irish pronunciation of giant.
